contentrichtext.text: '''Zhongdu''' is the [[pinyin]] [[romanization of Chinese|romanization]] of the [[Chinese character]]s {{lang-zh|中都}}, meaning "Central Capital". It may refer to: * Zhongdu, the capital of the [[Jin_Dynasty_(1115-1234)|Jurchen Jin Dynasty]] during the 12th century. It was located in present-day [[History of Beijing#Liao and Jin Dynasties|Beijing]]. * Zhongdu, the proposed future capital of the [[Ming Dynasty]] mooted during the 14th century. It was located at the former site of Zhongli ({{lang|zh|鍾離}}), a destroyed village whose ruins are located in modern [[Fengyang]] in [[Anhui]]. '''Zhongdu''', written with other Chinese characters, is also used for other place names: * [[Zhongdu, Luzhai County]] ({{lang|zh|中渡镇}}), a town in [[Luzhai County]], [[Guangxi]] * [[Zhongdu, Shanghang County]], town in Fujian {{disambig}}
